title: Byzantine Mystical Theology: Hesychasm & Apophatic Tradition
description: The Byzantine mystical tradition from Pseudo-Dionysius's negative theology through the hesychast prayer tradition: the Philokalia, Maximus the Confessor's cosmic theology, Symeon the New Theologian's experiential mysticism, and Gregory Palamas's defense of hesychasm.
keyWorks: Pseudo-Dionysius: Negative theology, celestial hierarchies - foundational for Western & Eastern mysticism
Philokalia: Collection of hesychast spiritual texts on prayer of the heart
Maximus Confessor: Cosmic Christology, logoi theory, mystical theology
Gregory Palamas: Defense of hesychasm, distinction between divine essence and energies
researchValue: Essential for understanding Byzantine spirituality and its influence on Western mysticism. The hesychast prayer tradition (Jesus Prayer) and Palamas's theology of divine energies represent the pinnacle of Orthodox mystical theology.
